ground_truth: In the arena office, $100 is laid on the desk in front of Peter, who waits expectantly. Peter screws up his face, glares at the promoter, and then storms out of the office, passing a tall, burly unshaven guy with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor, Peter overhears and, through the frosted glass wall, sees the gunman rob the promoter and make his escape. Peter stands aside as the robber escapes in the elevator. The promoter, with a gash on the right side of his temple, sneers at him. Peter then heads back along the corridor after the security guard and smacks as he calls the elevator, outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. He watches police cars draw up and sees a crowd of people milling around on the sidewalk. He looks on curiously and pushes his way through the crowd to find a gray-haired old man lying on the ground. Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and tries to focus. His eyes light on Peter, and he attempts a smile, taking his nephew's right hand in his. Uncle Ben's eyes close, his head lulls to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's grasp. Peter, tears running down his cheeks, looks at the peaceful face of his dead uncle as the young man sobs. Having overheard the cop, Peter's face grows determined, his jaw set. He stands up and walks away, runs into a dark alleyway, pulls off his zipped-up jogging top, and puts on his balaclava. Spider-Man leaps up on a wall at the end of the alleyway, clambers, climbs, and leaps up the side of a building, scurrying along with great speed. He spots a flagpole on a building opposite, jumps sailing through the air, grabs the pole with both hands, and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. He leaps from roof to roof until he lands on top of a dome. Far below, he sees the automobile being chased by police, shoots a web to an adjacent building, and looks up at the corners of the building to which his web is attached. Glancing down at the streets way below, he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite, he shoots another web to pull him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground, he shoots out another web and pulls himself along, like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: In the stadium bureau, $100 is placed on the bureau in front of Peter, who waits eagerly. Peter screws up his visage, glowers at the promoter, and then storms out of the bureau, passing a lofty, muscular unshaven fellow with bleached hair who barges in and hurls a fabric bag at the promoter. In the hallway, Peter overhears and, through the frosted glass partition, sees the gunman rob the promoter and make his getaway. Peter stands aside as the thief escapes in the lift. The promoter, with a cut on the right side of his forehead, sneers at him. Peter then heads back along the hallway after the security guard and smacks as he calls the lift, outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. He observes police vehicles draw up and sees a throng of individuals milling around on the pavement. He looks on inquisitively and pushes his route through the throng to find a silver-haired elderly man lying on the ground. Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and tries to concentrate. His eyes light on Peter, and he attempts a grin, taking his nephew's right hand in his. Uncle Ben's eyes close, his head lulls to one flank, and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's clutch. Peter, tears streaming down his cheeks, looks at the serene visage of his deceased uncle as the young man sobs. Having overheard the officer, Peter's face grows resolved, his jaw set. He stands up and walks away, runs into a shadowy passageway, pulls off his zipped-up jogging top, and puts on his balaclava. Spider-Man bounds up on a partition at the end of the passageway, scrambles, ascends, and bounds up the side of a structure, scuttling along with great velocity. He spots a flagpole on a structure opposite, jumps sailing through the atmosphere, grabs the pole with both hands, and swings round and round to build the impetus to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. He leaps from roof to roof until he lands on top of a cupola. Far below, he sees the machine being pursued by police, shoots a web to an adjacent structure, and looks up at the corners of the structure to which his web is attached. Glancing down at the streets way below, he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the cupola. As he races towards the structure opposite, he shoots another web to pull him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems he is going to fall to the ground, he shoots out another web and pulls himself along, like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: In the arena office, $100 has been laid on the desk in front of Peter, who is waiting expectantly. Peter's face is screwed up by him, he glares at the promoter, and then he storms out of the office. He passes a tall, burly unshaven guy with bleached hair, who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor, Peter overhears the gunman robbing the promoter and, through the frosted glass wall, sees the escape made by him. Peter stands aside as the robber makes his escape in the elevator. A sneer is given to him by the promoter, with a gash on the right side of his temple. Peter then heads back along the corridor after the security guard and smacks as the elevator is called by him, outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. Police cars are watched by him as they draw up and a crowd of people is seen milling around on the sidewalk. He looks on curiously and pushes his way through the crowd to find a gray-haired old man lying on the ground. As the man opens his eyes and tries to focus, Peter is beside him. His eyes light on Peter, and a smile is attempted by him, taking his nephew's right hand in his. Uncle Ben's eyes close, his head lulls to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until the youth's grasp lets his hand slip out. Tears running down his cheeks, Peter looks at the peaceful face of his dead uncle as the young man sobs. Having heard the cop, determination grows on Peter's face, his jaw is set by him. He stands up and walks away, runs into a dark alleyway, pulls off his zipped-up jogging top, and puts on his balaclava. Spider-Man leaps up on a wall at the end of the alleyway, clambers, climbs, and leaps up the side of a building, scurrying along with great speed. A flagpole on a building opposite is spotted by him, and he jumps sailing through the air, grabs the pole with both hands, and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. Roofs are leapt from by him until he lands on top of a dome. Far below, he sees the automobile being chased by police, shoots a web to an adjacent building, and looks up at the corners of the building to which his web is attached. The streets way below are glanced at by him, he takes a deep breath, and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite, he shoots another web to pull him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground, another web is shot out by him and he pulls himself along, like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: In the arena office, $100 sits on the desk before Peter, who waits expectantly. Annoyed, he glares at the promoter and storms out, passing a burly, unshaven guy with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor, Peter overhears and sees the gunman rob the promoter through the frosted glass wall. He steps aside as the robber escapes in the elevator. The promoter, sporting a gash on his temple, sneers at him. Peter follows the security guard, calling the elevator outside while wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. He observes police cars arriving and a crowd gathered on the sidewalk. Curiously, he pushes through to find a gray-haired man on the ground. The man opens his eyes and smiles weakly at Peter, his nephew, before slipping away. Tears streaming, Peter mourns his uncle's peaceful face. Determined, Peter's jaw sets, and he runs into an alleyway, dons a balaclava, and transforms into Spider-Man. He climbs a wall, leaps up a building, and swings across a flagpole to a rooftop. Jumping from roof to roof, he spots a car being chased below, shoots a web to an adjacent building, and launches off a dome. He zig-zags above the streets, shooting webs like Tarzan swinging from vines to avoid falling.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: In the arena office, $100 sits in front of Peter, who glares at the promoter and storms out, passing a tall, burly man with bleached hair. Through frosted glass, Peter sees the gunman rob the promoter, who sneers with a temple gash. Outside, police cars and a crowd gather as Peter finds his uncle, Ben, on the ground. Ben smiles weakly, holding Peter's hand before dying, leaving Peter grieving. Determined after hearing a cop, Peter dons a balaclava, becoming Spider-Man. He scales buildings, leaps from roofs, and swings on flagpoles, chasing a car pursued by police. Like Tarzan, he zigzags with his webs, avoiding plummeting while pursuing the car.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In the bustling arena office, the sum of $100 is visibly placed on the desk right in front of Peter, who is sitting and waiting in anticipation. Peter screws up his face in frustration, glaring angrily at the promoter before deciding to storm out of the office. As he makes his exit, he passes by a tall, burly man who is unshaven, with bleached hair, who barges rudely into the room and forcefully throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor outside, Peter overhears the proceedings and, through the frosted glass wall, witnesses the gunman rob the promoter and make a quick escape. Peter stands aside, allowing the robber to flee via the elevator. The promoter, now with a noticeable gash on the right side of his temple, sneers at Peter as he departs. Subsequently, Peter makes his way back along the corridor after encountering a security guard, smacking the wall as he calls for the elevator, now outside dressed in a hooded jogging top worn over his sweatshirt. He observes as police cars draw up to the scene and notices a crowd of people churning around on the sidewalk. Watching with curiosity, he pushes his way through the throng only to discover a gray-haired old man lying helplessly on the ground. Peter is right beside him as the elderly man opens his eyes, trying to focus. Uncle Ben's eyes settle on Peter, and he attempts a faint smile, reaching out to take his nephew's right hand in a feeble grip. Uncle Ben's eyes then close, his head lolls to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand gradually loosens until his hand slips gently out of the young man's grasp. With tears streaming down his cheeks, Peter gazes at the serene face of his deceased uncle, sobbing quietly. Having overheard the police officer nearby, Peter's face becomes resolute, his jaw setting firmly. He stands up, walks away, and then makes a quick run into a darkened alleyway. There, he pulls off his zipped-up jogging top and dons his balaclava. Transformed into Spider-Man, he adeptly leaps up onto a wall at the far end of the alleyway, clambering and climbing swiftly up the side of a tall building. He moves with incredible speed, spotting a flagpole on a building across from him. He jumps, sailing through the air gracefully, grabbing the pole with both hands. He swings around repeatedly to build the momentum needed to catapult himself through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. He leaps from one rooftop to another until he lands securely on top of a dome. Far below him, he observes an automobile being chased by police. He shoots a web towards an adjacent building and looks up at the corners of the structure to which his web is attached. Glancing back down at the streets far below, he takes a deep, steadying breath and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite, he shoots another web to propel himself away, then shoots yet another, zig-zagging high above the bustling streets below. Each time it seems as though he might plummet to the ground, he quickly shoots out another web and pulls himself along, much like Tarzan swinging effortlessly from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In the bustling and chaotic atmosphere of the arena office, a crisp sum of $100 is prominently displayed, sitting right on the desk in front of Peter. He is seated there, waiting with a growing sense of anticipation. Frustration builds as Peter screws up his face, glaring angrily at the promoter—his eyes full of resentment—before deciding to storm out of the office in a huff. As he forcefully makes his exit, he passes by a tall, burly man who is rugged and unshaven, with bleached hair. This man rudely barges into the room and aggressively throws a canvas bag at the promoter in a violent manner. Standing in the corridor outside, Peter overhears the tense proceedings through the door and, with a clear view through the frosted glass wall, witnesses the gunman robbing the promoter, making a quick escape thereafter. Peter stands aside, allowing the robber to flee discreetly via the elevator. The promoter, now with a noticeable and painful-looking gash on the right side of his temple, sneers at Peter as he leaves. Subsequently, Peter makes his way back along the corridor and, after encountering a security guard, he smacks the wall in frustration as he waits for the elevator, now outside clad in a hooded jogging top that he wears over his sweatshirt. He observes from a distance as police cars arrive at the chaotic scene, noticing a crowd of people bustling around on the sidewalk. Watching with growing curiosity, he pushes his way through the thronging mass only to discover, to his horror, a gray-haired old man lying helplessly on the cold ground. Peter finds himself right beside this elderly man as the man opens his eyes, struggling to focus. Uncle Ben's eyes finally settle on Peter, and he attempts a faint smile, reaching out with effort to take his nephew's right hand in a weak and unsteady grip. Uncle Ben's eyes then close once more, his head lolls gently to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand gradually loosens until it slips quietly out of the young man's grasp. Tears well up and stream down Peter's cheeks as he gazes at the serene face of his beloved, now deceased, uncle, sobbing quietly in his grief-stricken state. After overhearing the police officer nearby, Peter's expression transforms; his face becomes resolute, and his jaw sets firmly. He stands up, walks away with determination, and then makes a swift and urgent run into a darkened alleyway. There, he quickly pulls off his zipped-up jogging top and dons his balaclava. Transformed into his alter ego, Spider-Man, he adeptly leaps up onto a wall at the far end of the alleyway, clambering and climbing swiftly up the side of a tall building. Moving with incredible speed, he spots a flagpole on a building across from where he is perched. He jumps, soaring gracefully through the air, grabbing the pole with both hands. He swings around repeatedly to generate the momentum necessary to catapult himself gracefully through the air onto the adjacent rooftop. He continues to leap from one rooftop to another until he lands securely on top of a dome. Far below him, his keen eyes catch sight of an automobile being frantically chased by the police. He shoots a web towards an adjacent building, his gaze following the line to the corners of the structure to which his web is securely attached. With a glance back down to the streets far below, he takes a deep, steadying breath before launching himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite, he expertly shoots another web to propel himself away, then expertly follows it with another, zig-zagging high above the bustling streets. Each time it looks as though he might plummet to the ground, he quickly shoots out another web and pulls himself along, much like Tarzan swinging effortlessly from vine to vine in the dense and wild jungle.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the arena office, Peter sits with anticipation etched across his face, his eyes fixed on the $100 bill that lies neatly on the desk before him. His expression transforms as he screws up his face and shifts his glare towards the promoter sitting across from him, seething silently before abruptly deciding to leave. Rising swiftly from his seat, Peter strides purposefully out of the office, his mind swirling with frustration, and crosses paths with a tall, burly figure with unkempt, bleached hair, who brushes past him in a rush. This unshaven man barges into the office and, without hesitation, hurls a canvas bag at the promoter. As Peter walks down the corridor, his steps echoing softly, he catches snippets of a commotion through the frosted glass wall. Curiosity piqued, he slows his pace, straining to overhear and catch a glimpse of the gunman inside robbing the promoter. The robber, finished with his heist, makes a brisk escape, darting past Peter who steps aside in a moment of involuntary compliance, watching as the elevator doors close behind the fleeing thief. Inside, the promoter, clutching a fresh gash on the right side of his temple, sneers back at Peter, a mix of disdain and pain on his face. Unfazed, Peter moves down the corridor, his pace quickening as he follows the security guard, who smacks the wall in frustration while summoning the elevator. Outside, Peter stands amidst the hustle and bustle, wearing a hooded jogging top layered over his casual sweatshirt. His eyes scan the scene, taking in the police cars drawing up with urgency, their sirens wailing, and the throng of onlookers gathered on the sidewalk. Driven by a need to understand, Peter nudges his way through the crowd, weaving in and out until he reaches the center of attention: a gray-haired old man sprawled on the ground. Kneeling beside him, Peter anxiously watches as the man stirs, his eyes blinking open and struggling to focus. Recognition flickers in the man's eyes as they land on Peter, and in that fleeting moment, he attempts a smile, taking Peter's right hand gently into his own, a silent exchange of affection. But as Uncle Ben's eyes drift shut once more, his head lolls to the side, the warmth of his touch fades, and his grip slackens until his hand slips away, leaving Peter alone with his grief. Overcome, tears streaming unchecked down his cheeks, Peter gazes at the serene face of his beloved uncle, now at peace. Amidst his sobs, he processes the police officer's words he overheard, and resolve washes over him, hardening his features and setting his jaw with newfound determination. Rising from his knees, Peter strides purposefully away, each step more resolute than the last. He breaks into a run, darting into the shadowed sanctuary of a dark alleyway, where he urgently sheds his zipped-up jogging top and dons a balaclava, a transformation into his alter ego, Spider-Man. His muscles tense with anticipation, Spider-Man leaps onto a wall at the alley's end, his fingers finding holds with practiced ease as he clambers and climbs, his movements fluid and swift. Reaching the building's side, he races upwards, propelled by both gravity and his own adrenaline, until he spots a flagpole on a nearby building. With a powerful jump, he launches himself through the air, stretching out his arms to seize the pole with both hands, using it to swing round and round, harnessing momentum to fling himself across the gap to the adjacent rooftop. He lands with practiced precision and continues his acrobatic journey, leaping agilely from roof to roof, until he finds himself perched atop a dome, surveying the scene below. From this vantage point, he spots the runaway automobile pursued relentlessly by police, and without a second thought, he shoots a web towards a nearby building. He quickly checks the web's attachment point and, glancing down at the city streets far below, takes a deep, steadying breath before hurling himself off the dome. Hurtling through the air towards the opposite building, he fires another web, skillfully pulling himself in a controlled arc, then another, weaving a complex, zig-zagging path high above the bustling streets beneath him. Each time he teeters on the brink of falling, he sends out a web, propelling himself onwards, swinging deftly like Tarzan from vine to vine, the city a blur beneath his feet.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the arena office, Peter waits expectantly in front of $100 on the desk, then glares at the promoter and storms out, passing a burly man who barges in to rob the promoter. In the corridor, Peter sees the robbery through a frosted glass wall and steps aside as the gunman escapes in the elevator. The promoter sneers at him with a gash on his temple. Peter then follows the security guard, wearing a hooded jogging top, and watches as police cars arrive, drawing a curious crowd. He pushes through to find his uncle Ben lying on the ground. As Ben weakly acknowledges him, Peter holds his hand until Ben passes away, leaving Peter in tears. Determined after overhearing a cop, Peter dons his balaclava and transforms into Spider-Man. He climbs the alley wall with agility, spotting a flagpole across and using it to swing onto a rooftop. Spider-Man leaps roof to roof, following an automobile chased by police, and uses webs to navigate the city's heights. He fearlessly swings from building to building, mastering the cityscape like Tarzan through a jungle.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: In the arena office, a modest $100, likely a standard fee for his work, is laid on the desk in front of Peter, who waits expectantly. Peter screws up his face, glares at the promoter, a well-known figure in underground wrestling circles, and then storms out of the office, passing a tall, burly unshaven guy with bleached hair, reminiscent of a typical henchman, who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor, Peter overhears and, through the frosted glass wall, sees the gunman, who is known for his swift heists, rob the promoter and make his escape. Peter stands aside as the robber escapes in the elevator, which is notoriously slow in this aging building. The promoter, with a gash on the right side of his temple from his encounter, sneers at him. Peter then heads back along the corridor after the security guard and smacks as he calls the elevator, outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt which sports the logo of his college athletics team. He watches police cars, sirens blaring, draw up and sees a crowd of people milling around on the sidewalk. He looks on curiously and pushes his way through the crowd to find a gray-haired old man lying on the ground. Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and tries to focus. His eyes light on Peter, and he attempts a smile, taking his nephew's right hand in his. Uncle Ben's eyes close, his head lulls to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's grasp. Peter, tears running down his cheeks, looks at the peaceful face of his dead uncle, a beloved father figure who had taught him profound life lessons, as the young man sobs. Having overheard the cop, whose face is stern and familiar from media coverage of high-profile cases, Peter's face grows determined, his jaw set. He stands up and walks away, runs into a dark alleyway, pulls off his zipped-up jogging top, and puts on his balaclava, a makeshift mask he crafted for anonymity. Spider-Man, a local superhero whose feats are whispered about among the city's residents, leaps up on a wall at the end of the alleyway, clambers, climbs, and leaps up the side of a building, scurrying along with great speed. He spots a flagpole on a building opposite, jumps sailing through the air, grabs the pole with both hands, and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. He leaps from roof to roof until he lands on top of a dome, an iconic feature of the historic district's architecture. Far below, he sees the automobile being chased by police, shoots a web, reminiscent of a spider's silk, to an adjacent building, and looks up at the corners of the building to which his web is attached. Glancing down at the streets way below, he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite, he shoots another web to pull him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the bustling streets. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground, he shoots out another web and pulls himself along, like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine, evoking the adventurous spirit of the classic literary jungle hero.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. He leaps from roof to roof until he lands on top of a dome. Glancing down at the streets way below he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite he shoots another web to pull him away then another as he zigzags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground. he shoots out another web and pulls himself along like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

Peter screws up his face glares at the promoter and then storms out of the office passing a tall burly unshaven guy with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor Peter overhears and through the frosted glass wall sees the gunman rob the promoter and make his escape. Peter stands aside as the robber escapes in the elevator. The promoter with a gash on the right side of his temple sneers at him. Peter then heads back along the corridor after the security guard and smacks as he calls the elevator outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. He watches police cars draw up and sees a crowd of people milling around on the sidewalk. He looks on curiously and pushes his way through the crowd to find a grayhaired old man lying on the ground. Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and tries to focus. His eyes light on Peter and he attempts a smile taking his nephew's right hand in his Uncle. Ben's eyes close his head lulls to one side and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's grasp. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Peter tears running down his cheeks looks at the peaceful face of his dead uncle as the young man sobs. Having overheard the cop Peter's face grows determined his jaw set. He stands up and walks away runs into a dark alleyway pulls off his zippedup jogging top and puts on his balaclava. SpiderMan leaps up on a wall at the end of the alleyway clambers climbs and leaps up the side of a building scurrying along with great speed. He spots a flagpole on a building opposite jumps sailing through the air grabs the pole with both hands and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. He leaps from roof to roof until he lands on top of a dome. Far below he sees the automobile being chased by police shoots a web to an adjacent building and looks up at the corners of the building to which his web is attached. Glancing down at the streets way below he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite he shoots another web to pull him away then another as he zigzags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground. he shoots out another web and pulls himself along like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.description: In the arena office 100 is laid on the desk in front of Peter who waits expectantly. Peter screws up his face glares at the promoter and then storms out of the office passing a tall burly unshaven guy with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor Peter overhears and through the frosted glass wall sees the gunman rob the promoter and make his escape. Peter stands aside as the robber escapes in the elevator. The promoter with a gash on the right side of his temple sneers at him. Peter then heads back along the corridor after the security guard and smacks as he calls the elevator outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. Far below he sees the automobile being chased by police shoots a web to an adjacent building and looks up at the corners of the building to which his web is attached. Glancing down at the streets way below he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the dome. As he races towards the building opposite he shoots another web to pull him away then another as he zigzags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground. he shoots out another web and pulls himself along like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: In the arena office 100 is laid on the desk in front of Peter who waits expectantly. Peter screws up his face glares at the promoter and then storms out of the office passing a tall burly unshaven guy with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor Peter overhears and through the frosted glass wall sees the gunman rob the promoter and make his escape. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground. he shoots out another web and pulls himself along like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: In the arena office, $100 is laid on the desk in front of a dog, who waits expectantly. The dog screws up its face, glares at the gardener, and then storms out of the office, passing a tall, burly unshaven cat with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the gardener. In the corridor, the dog overhears and, through the frosted glass wall, sees the janitor rob the gardener and make his escape. The dog stands aside as the thief escapes in the elevator. The gardener, with a gash on the right side of his temple, sneers at the dog. The dog then heads back along the corridor after the firefighter and smacks as the dog calls the elevator, outside wearing a hooded jogging top over its sweatshirt. The dog watches police cars draw up and sees a crowd of people milling around on the sidewalk. The dog looks on curiously and pushes its way through the crowd to find a gray-haired old robot lying on the ground. The dog is beside the robot as the robot opens its eyes and tries to focus. The robot's eyes light on the dog, and it attempts a smile, taking its gardener's right hand in its. The robot's eyes close, its head lulls to one side, and its grip on the dog's hand loosens until its hand slips out of the youth's grasp. The dog, tears running down its cheeks, looks at the peaceful face of its dead gardener as the young bird sobs. Having overheard the professor, the dog's face grows determined, its jaw set. It stands up and walks away, runs into a dark alleyway, pulls off its zipped-up jogging top, and puts on its balaclava. A horse leaps up on a wall at the end of the alleyway, clambers, climbs, and leaps up the side of a building, scurrying along with great speed. It spots a flagpole on a building opposite, jumps sailing through the air, grabs the pole with both hands, and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult it through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. It leaps from roof to roof until it lands on top of a dome. Far below, it sees the bicycle being chased by police, shoots a web to an adjacent building, and looks up at the corners of the building to which its web is attached. Glancing down at the streets way below, it takes a deep breath and launches itself off the dome. As it races towards the building opposite, it shoots another web to pull it away, then another, as it zig-zags far above the trolling streets. Each time it seems it is going to plummet to the ground, it shoots out another web and pulls itself along, like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In the stadium office, $100 is laid on the table in front of Peter, who waits expectantly. Peter screws up his face, glares at the manager, and then storms out of the office, passing a tall, burly unshaven guy with dyed hair who barges in and throws a duffel bag at the manager. In the hallway, Peter overhears and, through the frosted glass partition, sees the thief rob the manager and make his escape. Peter stands aside as the robber escapes in the escalator. The manager, with a bruise on the right side of his forehead, sneers at him. Peter then heads back along the hallway after the security guard and smacks as he calls the escalator, outside wearing a hooded windbreaker over his sweatshirt. He watches ambulances arrive and sees a group of people milling around on the roadside. He looks on curiously and pushes his way through the group to find a bald old man lying on the ground. Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and tries to focus. His eyes light on Peter, and he attempts a smile, taking his nephew's right hand in his. Uncle Ben's eyes close, his head lulls to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's grasp. Peter, tears running down his cheeks, looks at the peaceful face of his deceased uncle as the young man sobs. Having overheard the detective, Peter's face grows determined, his jaw set. He stands up and walks away, runs into a dim alleyway, pulls off his zipped-up windbreaker, and puts on his ski mask. Spider-Man leaps up on a fence at the end of the alleyway, clambers, climbs, and leaps up the side of a skyscraper, scurrying along with great speed. He spots a weathervane on a tower opposite, jumps sailing through the air, grabs the vane with both hands, and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining terrace. He leaps from terrace to terrace until he lands on top of a spire. Far below, he sees the bus being chased by ambulances, shoots a web to an adjacent skyscraper, and looks up at the corners of the skyscraper to which his web is attached. Glancing down at the avenues way below, he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the spire. As he races towards the skyscraper opposite, he shoots another web to pull him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the bustling avenues. Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground, he shoots out another web and pulls himself along, like Tarzan swinging from rope to rope.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: In the arena office, $100 is balanced on the desk in front of Peter, who stares expectantly. Peter raises his eyebrows, glances at the promoter, and then skips out of the office, passing a tall, burly unshaven guy with bleached hair who saunters in and drops a canvas bag at the promoter. In the corridor, Peter observes and, through the frosted glass wall, sees the gunman tickle the promoter and begin his escape. Peter steps aside as the robber dances in the elevator. The promoter, with a gash on the right side of his temple, snickers at him. Peter then strolls back along the corridor after the security guard and hums as he calls the elevator, outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt. He watches police cars amble up and sees a crowd of people lounging around on the sidewalk. He looks on curiously and weaves his way through the crowd to find a gray-haired old man sitting on the ground. Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and squints. His eyes land on Peter, and he attempts a chuckle, gently patting his nephew's right hand in his. Uncle Ben's eyes close, his head droops to one side, and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's grasp. Peter, laughter rolling down his cheeks, looks at the peaceful face of his resting uncle as the young man beams. Having overheard the cop, Peter's face grows inquisitive, his jaw slackens. He stands up and jogs away, skips into a dim alleyway, pulls off his zipped-up jogging top, and puts on his cap. Spider-Man crawls up on a wall at the end of the alleyway, skitters, hops, and crawls up the side of a building, wandering along with great speed. He spots a flagpole on a building opposite, jumps gliding through the air, touches the pole with both hands, and circles round and round to build the momentum to propel him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop. He hops from roof to roof until he lands on top of a dome. Far below, he notices the automobile being followed by police, launches a web to an adjacent building, and glances up at the corners of the building to which his web is connected. Peering down at the streets way below, he exhales deeply and hurls himself off the dome. As he glides towards the building opposite, he flings another web to pull him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the winding streets. Each time it seems he is going to drift to the ground, he casts out another web and swings himself along, like Tarzan dancing from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In the aquarium lobby, $100 is placed on the bookshelf in front of Maxwell, who waits eagerly. Maxwell scrunches up his nose, glowers at the accountant, and then storms out of the lobby, passing a short, lean clean-shaven woman with blue hair who barges in and throws a metal suitcase at the accountant. In the hallway, Maxwell eavesdrops and, through the frosted glass window, sees the artist bamboozle the accountant and make her departure. Maxwell stands aside as the escapist departs in the escalator. The accountant, with a scrape on the left side of her cheek, smirks at her. Maxwell then heads back along the hallway after the librarian and bumps as she calls the escalator, outside wearing a hooded raincoat over her cardigan. She watches ambulances pull up and sees a cluster of spectators mingling on the street corner. She looks on inquisitively and nudges her way through the throng to find a blond-haired young woman sprawled on the pavement. Maxwell is beside her as the woman blinks her eyes and tries to concentrate. Her gaze settles on Maxwell, and she attempts a grin, taking her brother's left hand in hers. Aunt May's eyes close, her head lulls to the other side, and her hold on Maxwell's hand slackens until her hand slips out of the cousin's grip. Maxwell, tears streaming down his face, looks at the tranquil visage of his departed aunt as the girl sobs. Having overheard the detective, Maxwell's face becomes resolute, his chin firm. He stands up and walks away, dashes into a dim alleyway, pulls off his buttoned-up raincoat, and puts on his ski mask. Robot-Man vaults up on a fence at the end of the alleyway, scuttles, scrambles, and vaults up the side of a skyscraper, scurrying along with great agility. He notices a lamppost on an apartment across, leaps soaring through the air, seizes the post with both feet, and twirls round and round to gain the momentum to fling him through the air onto the neighboring penthouse. He jumps from terrace to terrace until he lands on top of a gazebo. Far below, he sees the bicycle being pursued by firefighters, fires a rope to an adjoining skyscraper, and looks up at the eaves of the skyscraper to which his rope is fastened. Peering down at the alleys far below, he inhales deeply and propels himself off the gazebo. As he speeds towards the skyscraper across, he fires another rope to drag him away, then another, as he zig-zags high above the bustling alleys. Each time it appears he is going to crash into the pavement, he fires out another rope and hoists himself along, like Indiana Jones swinging from whip to whip.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: In the gallery lounge, $100 is perched on the chair in front of Charlie, who ponders absentmindedly. Charlie scrunches his eyebrows, frowns at the director, and then strides out of the lounge, passing a short, stocky clean-shaven woman with curly hair who rushes in and tosses a leather satchel at the director. In the hallway, Charlie eavesdrops and, through the frosted glass wall, witnesses the thief con the director and make her exit. Charlie steps aside as the thief departs in the escalator. The director, with a bruise on the left side of her jaw, smirks at her. Charlie then proceeds back along the hallway after the janitor and claps as she presses the escalator button, outside wearing a tailored blazer over her dress. She observes police vans roll up and sees a group of animals gathering on the pavement. She gazes on inquisitively and nudges her way through the group to find a brown-haired young girl sitting on the ground. Charlie is next to her as the girl opens her eyes and tries to concentrate. Her eyes fix on Charlie, and she attempts a grin, grasping her cousin's left hand in hers. Aunt May's eyes close, her head tilts to one side, and her grip on Charlie's hand slackens until her hand slips out of the woman's grasp. Charlie, tears streaming down her cheeks, gazes at the serene face of her deceased aunt as the young lady cries. Having eavesdropped on the detective, Charlie's face becomes resolute, her mouth firm. She rises and ambles away, dashes into a well-lit corridor, unbuttons her tailored blazer, and puts on her scarf. Catwoman vaults up a staircase at the end of the hallway, wanders, glides, and vaults up the side of a skyscraper, skimming along with great speed. She notices a billboard on a skyscraper opposite, flips soaring through the air, grabs the billboard with both hands, and twirls around and around to build the momentum to propel her through the air onto the nearby rooftop. She springs from roof to roof until she lands on top of a tower. Far below, she sees the bicycle being tailed by detectives, flings a lasso to an adjacent skyscraper, and looks up at the edges of the skyscraper to which her lasso is attached. Peering down at the avenues way below, she exhales deeply and propels herself off the tower. As she dashes towards the skyscraper opposite, she flings another lasso to pull her across, then another, as she zig-zags far above the bustling avenues. Each time it seems she is going to tumble to the ground, she flings out another lasso and hauls herself along, like Jane swinging from tendril to tendril.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: In the garden shed, a jar of cookies is perched on the table in front of Peter, who waits eagerly. Peter wrinkles his nose, squints at the gardener, and then shuffles out of the shed, passing a lanky, muscular bearded chap with dyed hair who strides in and tosses a picnic basket at the gardener. In the hallway, Peter eavesdrops and, through the stained-glass window, sees the musician serenade the gardener and take his leave. Peter steps aside as the minstrel departs on the escalator. The gardener, with a bruise on the left side of his forehead, grimaces at him. Peter then wanders back along the hallway after the janitor and gesticulates as he summons the escalator, outside wearing a knitted cardigan over his vest. He observes ambulances roll in and sees a swarm of bees hovering around on the grass. He peers curiously and maneuvers his way through the throng to find a silver-haired elderly woman reclining on the bench. Peter is beside her as the woman opens her eyes and tries to focus. Her eyes settle on Peter, and she attempts a grin, grasping her grandson's left hand in hers. Aunt May's eyes close, her head tilts to one side, and her grip on Peter's hand slackens until her hand drifts out of the youth's grasp. Peter, tears streaming down his cheeks, gazes at the serene face of his deceased aunt as the young man weeps. Having overheard the magician, Peter's face grows resolute, his jaw firm. He stands up and ambles away, dashes into a bright courtyard, peels off his buttoned-up cardigan, and dons his bandana. Spider-Man springs onto a fence at the end of the courtyard, scrambles, scales, and bounds up the side of a tower, scuttling along with great haste. He notices a gargoyle on a tower opposite, leaps soaring through the air, clutches the gargoyle with both hands, and swings round and round to gather the force to fling him through the air onto the neighboring terrace. He bounds from terrace to terrace until he lands atop a spire. Far below, he sees the bicycle being pursued by police, tosses a thread to a nearby tower, and looks up at the ledges of the tower to which his thread is affixed. Casting a glance down at the lanes far below, he exhales deeply and hurls himself off the spire. As he dashes towards the tower opposite, he flings another thread to tug him away, then another, as he zig-zags far above the bustling lanes. Each time it seems he is going to descend to the ground, he casts out another thread and swings himself along, like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In the library basement, a stack of pancakes is perched on a chair in front of Lucy, who taps impatiently. Lucy paints her nails, winks at the librarian, and then dances out of the basement, passing a short, slender bearded woman with curly hair who bounces in and hurls a cushion at the librarian. In the hallway, Lucy eavesdrops and, through the stained glass window, sees the cartoonist sketch the librarian and make her retreat. Lucy steps aside as the artist retreats on the skateboard. The librarian, with a scratch on the left side of her chin, giggles at her. Lucy then skips back along the hallway after the janitor and whistles as she calls the skateboard, outside wearing a frilly tutu over her sweater vest. She watches fire trucks pull up and sees a group of ducks waddling around on the pavement. She looks on amusedly and squeezes her way through the ducks to find a red-beaked old penguin lying on the grass. Lucy is beside him as the penguin opens his beak and tries to focus. His gaze locks on Lucy, and he attempts a squawk, taking his niece's left wing in his. Grandpa Joe's eyes close, his head tilts to one side, and his grip on Lucy's wing slackens until his wing slips out of the girl's grasp. Lucy, tears cascading down her cheeks, looks at the serene face of her lifeless grandpa as the girl cries. Having eavesdropped on the parrot, Lucy's face grows resolute, her chin firm. She stands up and skips away, runs into a dim lane, pulls off her buttoned-up tutu, and puts on her sunhat. Captain Adventure bounds up on a fence at the edge of the lane, tiptoes, scrambles, and bounds up the side of a tree, darting along with great dexterity. She spots a wind vane on a house across the street, leaps gliding through the breeze, grips the vane with both feet, and spins round and round to gather the momentum to fling her through the air onto the neighboring balcony. She hops from balcony to balcony until she lands atop a gazebo. Far below, she sees the scooter being tailed by firefighters, tosses a rope to a neighboring house, and gazes up at the corners of the house to which her rope is attached. Peering down at the avenues way below, she gulps and propels herself off the gazebo. As she dashes towards the house across the street, she tosses another rope to steer her away, then another, as she zig-zags high above the trudging avenues. Each time it seems she is going to tumble to the ground, she hurls out another rope and propels herself along, like a monkey swinging from branch to branch.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In the arena office, $100 sits before Peter, who storms out after a tense confrontation with the promoter. Outside, Peter witnesses a burly robber steal from the promoter and escape. Later, Peter finds his Uncle Ben dying on the ground, holds his hand as he passes, and grieves deeply. Determined, Peter dons his Spider-Man gear and leaps into action. He scales walls and rooftops, swinging through the city with webs to pursue the fleeing robber. Racing over buildings, Spider-Man deftly navigates the urban landscape, shooting webs to keep from falling, much like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine.

test_cases.description: Peter tears running down his cheeks looks at the peaceful face of his dead uncle as the young man sobs Having overheard the cop Peter's face grows determined his jaw set He stands up and walks away runs into a dark alleyway pulls off his zippedup jogging top and puts on his balaclava SpiderMan leaps up on a wall at the end of the alleyway clambers climbs and leaps up the side of a building scurrying along with great speed He spots a flagpole on a building opposite jumps sailing through the air grabs the pole with both hands and swings round and round to build the momentum to catapult him through the air onto the adjoining rooftop He leaps from roof to roof until he lands on top of a dome Far below he sees the automobile being chased by police shoots a web to an adjacent building and looks up at the corners of the building to which his web is attached Glancing down at the streets way below he takes a deep breath and launches himself off the dome As he races towards the building opposite he shoots another web to pull him away then another as he zigzags far above the trolling streets Each time it seems he is going to plummet to the ground he shoots out another web and pulls himself along like Tarzan swinging from vine to vine In the arena office 100 is laid on the desk in front of Peter who waits expectantly Peter screws up his face glares at the promoter and then storms out of the office passing a tall burly unshaven guy with bleached hair who barges in and throws a canvas bag at the promoter In the corridor Peter overhears and through the frosted glass wall sees the gunman rob the promoter and make his escape Peter stands aside as the robber escapes in the elevator The promoter with a gash on the right side of his temple sneers at him Peter then heads back along the corridor after the security guard and smacks as he calls the elevator outside wearing a hooded jogging top over his sweatshirt He watches police cars draw up and sees a crowd of people milling around on the sidewalk He looks on curiously and pushes his way through the crowd to find a grayhaired old man lying on the ground Peter is beside him as the man opens his eyes and tries to focus His eyes light on Peter and he attempts a smile taking his nephew's right hand in his Uncle Ben's eyes close his head lulls to one side and his grip on Peter's hand loosens until his hand slips out of the youth's grasp
